com.immortallabs.cardboard.game
Class GameState

java.lang.Object
  com.immortallabs.cardboard.game.GameState
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.Observer
public class GameState
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Observer

The GameState Class models the gameplay rules of the Sets Game. In addition to it's own internal gameplay policies, it utilizes classes such as SetsBoard and Deck to enforce the rules of the game. It has a Deck, a Score for each Player, a Timer, a set of Preferences, a set of High Scores, and a User Interface from which it can query information about the user.

Operations:
  • The GameState class can provide the user interface information about the game state
  • The GameState class can update the game state based on user interactions

Version:
1.3, January 10th, 2009
Author:
Justin C. Appler, Immortal Labs, CSC309 W09
See Also:
Deck, CardBoardUI, SetsBoard, CardBoardPreferences
Version History:
- 01/10/09 1.3 Changed Name to GameState, Updated Version/Author Info
- 12/04/08 1.2 ACTION Change, Conformed JavaDocs, More Pseudocoding
- 12/02/08 1.1 Added Version History & Pseudocode
- 12/01/08 1.0 Initial Class Skeleton

Constructor Detail

GameState

public GameState(boolean debug)
Creates a new GameState class which subsequently creates new copies of each component of the Sets Game

Parameters:
debug - Whether or not to start in debugging mode
true causes GameState to use an unshuffled deck
false causes GameState to use a shuffled deck
Method Detail

addThreeMoreCards

private void addThreeMoreCards()
Attempts to add 3 more cards to the game board. If the game board currently has a set, causes a score reduction and doesn't change the board. In multiplayer, there is no score reduction.

announceGameWinner

private void announceGameWinner()
Tells the UI to announce that a player in a multiplayer game has won.

public Timer getTimer()
Returns the Timer for the current games state.

Returns:
The Timer for the current games state

handleTimerExpiration

private void handleTimerExpiration()
Updates the game state when the timer expires at the end of a countdown. If the current game is multiplayer, the player buzzed in loses points for not completing a set in time. If the game is competitive, the player loses points for running out of time before finding a set.

inlayCardSelect

private void inlayCardSelect()
Updates the state of the game after a user selected a card in the inlay.

inlayFull

private void inlayFull(GameState.PLAYER selectPlayer)
Handles the situation in which the game board inlay is full

Parameters:
selectPlayer - The player who added the last card

pauseGame

private void pauseGame()
Pauses the current game

Parameters:
action - The User Action to process

update

public void update(java.util.Observable observed,
                   java.lang.Object argument)
Updates the game state when an observed object has been changed. Currently, this method only monitors the Timer class for expiration.

Specified by:
update in interface java.util.Observer
Parameters:
observed - The object being observed for changes
argument - The argument passed from the observed object

useHint

private void useHint()
Attempts to use a Hint to find the next card in the Set. If the current game is Competitive, no action is taken.
